thread.title: Auburn Gameday: Guide to Lexington entertainment options featuring bourbon tour, thoroughbred racing and more
thread.title_full: Auburn Gameday: Guide to Lexington entertainment options featuring bourbon tour, thoroughbred racing and more

author: Amber Sutton | asutton@al.com
title: Auburn Gameday: Guide to Lexington entertainment options featuring bourbon tour, thoroughbred racing and more
text:
Comments 
With the Tigers facing off against the Wildcats tonight at Commonwealth Stadium, Lexington is sure to have a rise in tourism as Auburn fans make the trip for the game and stick around for the weekend. 
For those Auburn fans looking to make the trip a weekend getaway following tonight's game, there are plenty of tourism attractions, things to do and dining experiences to try out in historic city. 
To help narrow down your choices, here's a look at a few of the museums, events and dining options offered in Lexington this weekend. 
Places to Visit 
There are plenty of attractions in Lexington to take up your time this weekend, including the state's famous horse park, the childhood home of Mary Todd Lincoln and more. While this is only a few of the city's many museums and historic sites, it'll give you a good idea of some of your options. 
Kentucky Horse Park 
Considering it's known as the "Horse Capital of the World," Lexington is the perfect place for horse lovers to spend a few days. The Kentucky Horse Park, which sits on 1,200 acres and is home to nearly 50 breeds of horses, is a must-see. The park also features a museum, horseback riding trails and special events. For more information, click here. 
Mary Todd Lincoln House 
For history enthusiasts, Lexington offers the chance to tour the childhood home of Mary Todd Lincoln, who eventually married Abraham Lincoln. The house features period furnishings as well as artifacts from the family's prominent history. Adult admission is $12. For more information, click here. 
University of Kentucky Art Museum 
It may feel strange visiting an attraction affiliated with the opposition, but it may be worth it considering Lexington is known for having one of the best art museums in the south. After all, the permanent collection includes pieces by DÃ¼rer, Lichtenstein, Chuck Close, and Rembrandt. Admission is free. For more information, click here. 
Shaker Village of Pleasant Hill 
At this National Historic Landmark, you can view the 19th century homes and other buildings as well as their goods and crafts. There's also a riverboat ride, trails and eating options for visitors to enjoy with learning more about the shakers' simple ways of living. For more information, click here. 
The Aviation Museum of Kentucky 
If you're already going to be at the Blue Grass Airport, why check out The Aviation Museum of Kentucky? It features restored aircrafts, including a Blue Angels A-4 Skyhawk, historic artifacts, interactive exhibits and more. For more information, click here. 
Things to Do 
If you've already visited most of the must-see sights of Lexington already, there are some special events happening this weekend that may be of interest. If you're a lover of history, horses, ghosts, bourbon or basketball, there's plenty of things to do. 
Keeneland Thoroughbred Racing 
Looking to see horses in action? The Keeneland Race Course, a national historic landmark, will have races daily through this weekend. General admission starts at only $5 with more seating options available for additional fees. For more information, click here. 
Liberty Hall Ghost Tour 
Want to know more about the haunted history of Lexington? Liberty Hall offers ghost tours that explores the back stories of the rumored spirits that still lurk at the historic site. Admission is $12 and times vary. For more information, click here. 
Kentucky Bourbon Tour s 
If you're interested in trying out a Kentucky Bourbon or two, there are several historic distilleries in Lexington to choose from, including The Woodford Reserve Distillery, Buffalo Trace, Four Roses, Town Branch Distillery and Wild Turkey. Decide which one speaks to you, and have your fill. For more information, click here. 
Pelicans vs. Kings game 
The New Orleans Pelicans and Sacramento Kings will play a pre-season game at the Lexington Center and Rupp Arena at 7 p.m. on Saturday for basketball fanatics eager to get the season going. Ticket prices vary. For more information, click here. 
Historic Downtown Walking Tour 
Want to get in some exercise, see the sights and learn a little about a lot of difference places in Lexington? This guided walking tour, which includes sites such as Henry Clay's law office, Patterson Cabin, Cheapside Park, the pre-civil war homes of Gratz Park, and more. allows you to do just that. For more information, click here. 
Dining Options 
While you're in Lexington, make sure you take advantage of the all the restaurants and dining establishments serving up uniquely delicious menus. To help you out, here's a look at eight of Lexington's highest rated and most popular restaurants according to Zomato.com. 
Gumbo Ya Ya
